random/beta.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*
00002  * Generate Beta random deviate
00003  *
00004  *   Returns a single random deviate from the beta distribution with
00005  *   parameters A and B.  The density of the beta is
00006  *             x^(a-1) * (1-x)^(b-1) / B(a,b) for 0 < x < 1
00007  *
00008  * The mean is a/(a+b).
00009  * The variance is ab/((a+b)^2(a+b+1))
00010  * The rth moment is (a+r-1)^(r)/(a+b+r-1)^(r)
00011  *   where a^(r) means a * (a-1) * (a-2) * ... * (a-r+1)
00012  *
00013  * Method
00014  *    R. C. H. Cheng
00015  *    Generating Beta Variates with Nonintegral Shape Parameters
00016  *    Communications of the ACM, 21:317-322  (1978)
00017  *    (Algorithms BB and BC)
00018  *    http://www.acm.org/pubs/citations/journals/toms/1991-17-1/p98-l_ecuyer/
00019  *
00020  * This class has been adapted from RANDLIB.C 1.3, by 
00021  * Barry W. Brown, James Lovato, Kathy Russell, and John Venier.
00022  * 
00023  * Adapter's note (TV): This code has gone from Pascal to Fortran to C.  
00024  * As a result it is a bit of a mess.  Note also that the algorithms were
00025  * originally designed for 32-bit float, and so some of the constants
00026  * below have inadequate precision.  This will not cause problems for
00027  * casual use, but if you are generating millions of beta variates and
00028  * rely on some convergence property, you may have want to worry
00029  * about this.
00030  *
00031  * NEEDS_WORK: dig out the original paper and determine these constants
00032  * to precision adequate for 128-bit float.
00033  * NEEDS_WORK: turn this into structured code.
00034  */
00035 
00036 #ifndef BZ_RANDOM_BETA
00037 #define BZ_RANDOM_BETA
00038 
00039 #ifndef BZ_RANDOM_UNIFORM
00040  #include <random/uniform.h>
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 #ifndef BZ_NUMINQUIRE_H
00044  #include <blitz/numinquire.h>
00045 #endif
00046 
00047 BZ_NAMESPACE(ranlib)
00048 
00049 template<typename T = double, typename IRNG = defaultIRNG, 
00050     typename stateTag = defaultState>
00051 class Beta : public UniformOpen<T,IRNG,stateTag>
00052 {
00053 public:
00054     typedef T T_numtype;
00055 
00056     Beta(T a, T b)
00057     {
00058       setParameters(a, b);
00059     }
00060 
00061   Beta(T a, T b, unsigned int i) : UniformOpen<T, IRNG, stateTag>(i)
00062     {
00063       setParameters(a, b);
00064     }
00065 
00066     T random();
00067 
00068     void setParameters(T a, T b)
00069     {
00070       aa = a;
00071       bb = b;
00072       infnty = 0.3 * blitz::huge(T());
00073       minlog = 0.085 * blitz::tiny(T());
00074       expmax = log(infnty);
00075     }
00076 
00077 protected:
00078     T ranf() 
00079     { 
00080         return UniformOpen<T,IRNG,stateTag>::random(); 
00081     }
00082 
00083     T aa, bb;
00084     T infnty, minlog, expmax;
00085 };
00086 
00087 template<typename T, typename IRNG, typename stateTag>
00088 T Beta<T,IRNG,stateTag>::random()
00089 {
00090 /* JJV changed expmax (log(1.0E38)==87.49823), and added minlog */
00091 
00092     // TV: The original code had infnty = 1.0E38, minlog = 1.0E-37.
00093     // I have changed these to 0.3 * huge and 8.5 * tiny.  For IEEE
00094     // float this works out to 1.020847E38 and 0.9991702E-37.
00095     // I changed expmax from 87.49823 to log(infnty), which works out
00096     // to 87.518866 for float.
00097 
00098     static T olda = minlog;
00099     static T oldb = minlog;
00100     static T genbet,a,alpha,b,beta,delta,gamma,k1,k2,r,s,t,u1,u2,v,w,y,z;
00101     static long qsame;
00102 
00103     // This code determines if the aa and bb parameters are unchanged.
00104     // If so, some code can be skipped.
00105 
00106     qsame = (olda == aa) && (oldb == bb);
00107 
00108     if (!qsame)
00109     {
00110       BZPRECHECK((aa > minlog) && (bb > minlog),
00111           "Beta RNG: parameters must be >= " << minlog << endl
00112           << "Parameters are aa=" << aa << " and bb=" << bb << endl);
00113       olda = aa;
00114       oldb = bb;
00115     }
00116 
00117     if (!(min(aa,bb) > 1.0)) 
00118       goto S100;
00119 /*
00120      Alborithm BB
00121      Initialize
00122 */
00123     if(qsame) goto S30;
00124     a = min(aa,bb);
00125     b = max(aa,bb);
00126     alpha = a+b;
00127     beta = sqrt((alpha-2.0)/(2.0*a*b-alpha));
00128     gamma = a+1.0/beta;
00129 S30:
00130 S40:
00131     u1 = ranf();
00132 /*
00133      Step 1
00134 */
00135     u2 = ranf();
00136     v = beta*log(u1/(1.0-u1));
00137 /* JJV altered this */
00138     if(v > expmax) goto S55;
00139 /*
00140  * JJV added checker to see if a*exp(v) will overflow
00141  * JJV S50 _was_ w = a*exp(v); also note here a > 1.0
00142  */
00143     w = exp(v);
00144     if(w > infnty/a) goto S55;
00145     w *= a;
00146     goto S60;
00147 S55:
00148     w = infnty;
00149 S60:
00150     z = pow(u1,2.0)*u2;
00151     r = gamma*v-1.3862944;
00152     s = a+r-w;
00153 /*
00154      Step 2
00155 */
00156     if(s+2.609438 >= 5.0*z) goto S70;
00157 /*
00158      Step 3
00159 */
00160     t = log(z);
00161     if(s > t) goto S70;
00162 /*
00163  *   Step 4
00164  *
00165  *    JJV added checker to see if log(alpha/(b+w)) will
00166  *    JJV overflow.  If so, we count the log as -INF, and
00167  *    JJV consequently evaluate conditional as true, i.e.
00168  *    JJV the algorithm rejects the trial and starts over
00169  *    JJV May not need this here since alpha > 2.0
00170  */
00171     if(alpha/(b+w) < minlog) goto S40;
00172     if(r+alpha*log(alpha/(b+w)) < t) goto S40;
00173 S70:
00174 /*
00175      Step 5
00176 */
00177     if(!(aa == a)) goto S80;
00178     genbet = w/(b+w);
00179     goto S90;
00180 S80:
00181     genbet = b/(b+w);
00182 S90:
00183     goto S230;
00184 S100:
00185 /*
00186      Algorithm BC
00187      Initialize
00188 */
00189     if(qsame) goto S110;
00190     a = max(aa,bb);
00191     b = min(aa,bb);
00192     alpha = a+b;
00193     beta = 1.0/b;
00194     delta = 1.0+a-b;
00195     k1 = delta*(1.38889E-2+4.16667E-2*b)/(a*beta-0.777778);
00196     k2 = 0.25+(0.5+0.25/delta)*b;
00197 S110:
00198 S120:
00199     u1 = ranf();
00200 /*
00201      Step 1
00202 */
00203     u2 = ranf();
00204     if(u1 >= 0.5) goto S130;
00205 /*
00206      Step 2
00207 */
00208     y = u1*u2;
00209     z = u1*y;
00210     if(0.25*u2+z-y >= k1) goto S120;
00211     goto S170;
00212 S130:
00213 /*
00214      Step 3
00215 */
00216     z = pow(u1,2.0)*u2;
00217     if(!(z <= 0.25)) goto S160;
00218     v = beta*log(u1/(1.0-u1));
00219 /*
00220  *    JJV instead of checking v > expmax at top, I will check
00221  *    JJV if a < 1, then check the appropriate values
00222  */
00223     if(a > 1.0) goto S135;
00224 /*   JJV a < 1 so it can help out if exp(v) would overflow */
00225     if(v > expmax) goto S132;
00226     w = a*exp(v);
00227     goto S200;
00228 S132:
00229     w = v + log(a);
00230     if(w > expmax) goto S140;
00231     w = exp(w);
00232     goto S200;
00233 S135:
00234 /*   JJV in this case a > 1 */
00235     if(v > expmax) goto S140;
00236     w = exp(v);
00237     if(w > infnty/a) goto S140;
00238     w *= a;
00239     goto S200;
00240 S140:
00241     w = infnty;
00242     goto S200;
00243 /*
00244  * JJV old code
00245  *    if(!(v > expmax)) goto S140;
00246  *    w = infnty;
00247  *    goto S150;
00248  *S140:
00249  *    w = a*exp(v);
00250  *S150:
00251  *    goto S200;
00252  */
00253 S160:
00254     if(z >= k2) goto S120;
00255 S170:
00256 /*
00257      Step 4
00258      Step 5
00259 */
00260     v = beta*log(u1/(1.0-u1));
00261 /*   JJV same kind of checking as above */
00262     if(a > 1.0) goto S175;
00263 /* JJV a < 1 so it can help out if exp(v) would overflow */
00264     if(v > expmax) goto S172;
00265     w = a*exp(v);
00266     goto S190;
00267 S172:
00268     w = v + log(a);
00269     if(w > expmax) goto S180;
00270     w = exp(w);
00271     goto S190;
00272 S175:
00273 /* JJV in this case a > 1.0 */
00274     if(v > expmax) goto S180;
00275     w = exp(v);
00276     if(w > infnty/a) goto S180;
00277     w *= a;
00278     goto S190;
00279 S180:
00280     w = infnty;
00281 /*
00282  *   JJV old code
00283  *    if(!(v > expmax)) goto S180;
00284  *    w = infnty;
00285  *    goto S190;
00286  *S180:
00287  *    w = a*exp(v);
00288  */
00289 S190:
00290 /*
00291  * JJV here we also check to see if log overlows; if so, we treat it
00292  * JJV as -INF, which means condition is true, i.e. restart
00293  */
00294     if(alpha/(b+w) < minlog) goto S120;
00295     if(alpha*(log(alpha/(b+w))+v)-1.3862944 < log(z)) goto S120;
00296 S200:
00297 /*
00298      Step 6
00299 */
00300     if(!(a == aa)) goto S210;
00301     genbet = w/(b+w);
00302     goto S220;
00303 S210:
00304     genbet = b/(b+w);
00305 S230:
00306 S220:
00307     return genbet;
00308 }
